events.description: Brent crude oil futures rose over 1% to above $68 per barrel, reversing earlier losses.
Negotiations between the US and Iran regarding nuclear issues, sanctions, and regional activities.
Saudi Arabia reduced prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020.

facts.fact_text: Brent crude oil futures rose over 1% to above $68 per barrel on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Brent crude oil futures rose over 1% to above $68 per barrel on Friday

facts.fact_text: Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020.

evidences.evidence_text: Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020

facts.fact_text: The US Virtual Embassy in Iran urged American citizens to leave immediately.

evidences.evidence_text: the US Virtual Embassy in Iran has also urged American citizens to leave immediately

claims.claim_text: Disagreements over the agenda in US–Iran talks made progress uncertain.

evidences.evidence_text: disagreements over the agenda in US–Iran high-stakes talks made progress uncertain

claims.claim_text: Saudi Arabia's price cut signals an oversupply in the market.
The smaller-than-expected price reduction by Saudi Arabia suggested confidence in demand.

evidences.evidence_text: the smaller-than-expected reduction suggested confidence in demand

evidence.evidence_text: disagreements over the agenda in US–Iran high-stakes talks made progress uncertain
rattled energy markets over potential supply disruptions from the OPEC producer
signaling oversupply, though the smaller-than-expected reduction suggested confidence in demand
